required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analysis of Microalbuminuria and Markers of Inflammation and Oxidative Stress in Adolescents of Different Ethnic Backgrounds
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of Microalbuminuria and Markers of Inflammation and Oxidative Stress in Adolescents of Different Ethnic Backgrounds

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if there are signs of inflammation in one's blood and urine and to find out if one's body size or ethnicity has an effect on these substances.

primary_outcome.measure: To compare plasma levels of inflammatory markers and urinary biomarkers of oxidative stress in adolescents of Hispanic, African-American and Caucasian ethnicity

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine if there is an independent correlation between these markers and urinary microalbumin excretion

biospec_descr.textblock: Aliquots from the citrate vial & Serum seperator vial are being retained

study_pop.textblock: pediatric out-patient at UCDavis Medical Center clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adolescents between 12 to 18 years old
- Hispanic, African American or Caucasian ethnicity
- Have a Body Mass Index (BMI) between the 5th and 85th percentile or greater than the 95th percentile
- Must currently be attending a UC Davis Pediatric clinic
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic liver or kidney disease, known Diabetes or other chronic illnesses (such as Sickle Cell Disease or Cystic Fibrosis)
- Subjects can NOT be acutely febrile, smoke, chronically use prescription medications or oral contraceptive pills.
